intro: Peucedanum pauciradiatum, commonly known as the narrow-rayed angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. It is native to Central Asia and is typically found in rocky or mountainous regions. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. However, it is important to note that the plant contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
